elements.content: Two novel metal−organic frameworks [Ni7(H2O)6L2(O)2](Cl)2(NO3)2·6(H2O)·(Emim)2 (1) and [Ni2(H2O)2L]·7(H2O) (2) have been successfully constructed by using ionothermal and hydrothermal synthesis, respectively. Compound 1 represents the new type metal−organic replicate of PoCl2 with the scu net containing an eight-connecting polynuclear cluster and a large four-connecting complex. Compound 2 showing a one-dimensional chain has been separated in a traditional hydrothermal method using similar starting materials. By inspection of the structures of 1 and 2, it is believed that the different reaction conditions play important roles in forming the final structures. In addition, we investigated the optical band gap of compound 1.
elements.clean_text: Two novel metal-organic frameworks [Ni7(H2O)6L2(O)2](Cl)2(NO3)2⋅6(H2O)⋅(Emim)2 (1) and [Ni2(H2O)2L]⋅7(H2O) (2) have been successfully constructed by using ionothermal and hydrothermal synthesis, respectively. Compound 1 represents the new type metal-organic replicate of PoCl2 with the scu net containing an eight-connecting polynuclear cluster and a large four-connecting complex. Compound 2 showing a one-dimensional chain has been separated in a traditional hydrothermal method using similar starting materials. By inspection of the structures of 1 and 2, it is believed that the different reaction conditions play important roles in forming the final structures. In addition, we investigated the optical band gap of compound 1.

elements.content: Two novel metal−organic frameworks [Ni7(H2O)6L2(O)2](Cl)2(NO3)2·6(H2O)·(Emim)2 (1) and [Ni2(H2O)2L]·7(H2O) (2) have been successfully constructed by using ionothermal and hydrothermal synthesis, respectively. Compound 1 represents the new type metal−organic replicate of PoCl2 with the scu net containing an eight-connecting polynuclear cluster and a large four-connecting complex. Compound 2 showing a one-dimensional chain has been separated in a traditional hydrothermal method using similar starting materials.
elements.clean_text: Two novel metal-organic frameworks [Ni7(H2O)6L2(O)2](Cl)2(NO3)2⋅6(H2O)⋅(Emim)2 (1) and [Ni2(H2O)2L]⋅7(H2O) (2) have been successfully constructed by using ionothermal and hydrothermal synthesis, respectively. Compound 1 represents the new type metal-organic replicate of PoCl2 with the scu net containing an eight-connecting polynuclear cluster and a large four-connecting complex. Compound 2 showing a one-dimensional chain has been separated in a traditional hydrothermal method using similar starting materials.

elements.content: In recent years, the rational design and assembly of metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) with well-regulated network structures have received remarkable attention in order to develop new functional materials with potential applications. MOFs are typically synthesized by traditional hydro-/solvothermal methods. Recently, ionic liquids (ILs), a class of organic solvents, have received much attention recently due to their peculiar properties, including unusually low melting points, nonvolatility, nonflammability, thermally stability, and recycle and versatile ability to dissolve many substances. Ionothermal synthesis, that is, the use of an ionic liquid as solvent and sometimes structure directing agent in the preparation of microporous crystalline solids, as an excellent synthetic method, has opened up a new route for the creation of novel inorganic and metal−organic framework compounds, which have been reviewed by Morris and Parnham.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

In recent years, the rational design and assembly of metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) with well-regulated network structures have received remarkable attention in order to develop new functional materials with potential applications. MOFs are typically synthesized by traditional hydro-/solvothermal methods. Recently, ionic liquids (ILs), a class of organic solvents, have received much attention recently due to their peculiar properties, including unusually low melting points, nonvolatility, nonflammability, thermally stability, and recycle and versatile ability to dissolve many substances. Ionothermal synthesis, that is, the use of an ionic liquid as solvent and sometimes structure directing agent in the preparation of microporous crystalline solids, as an excellent synthetic method, has opened up a new route for the creation of novel inorganic and metal-organic framework compounds, which have been reviewed by Morris and Parnham.

elements.content: The topological analysis of MOFs has become a topical research area and is not only an important tool for simplifying complicated compounds but also plays an instructive role in the rational design of certain functional materials with desirable properties. To date, a variety of uninodal network topologies that are based on three-, four-, and six-connected topologies and so on have been realized so far. On the other hand, some metal−organic frameworks with mixed-connected topologies have been reported, for example, Pt3O4, boracite, twisted boracite, PtS, rutile, pyrite, and anatase. However, there is an unfavorable lack of investigation on binodal high-connected structures, such as (3,8)-, (4,8)-, (3,9)-, and (3,10)-connected frameworks. Recently, our group has reported the first (6,8)-connected self-penetrating network using an asymmetric neutral ligand based on dinuclear zinc clusters, as six-connected nodes, and trinuclear zinc clusters, as eight-connected nodes. It is a great challenge to achieve MOFs based on binodal high-connected nets in coordination chemistry. Among the reported binodal high-connected structures, connected nodes are always various metal clusters and/or organic ligand. The metal organic complex as a node is scarce.
elements.clean_text: The topological analysis of MOFs has become a topical research area and is not only an important tool for simplifying complicated compounds but also plays an instructive role in the rational design of certain functional materials with desirable properties. To date, a variety of uninodal network topologies that are based on three-, four-, and six-connected topologies and so on have been realized so far. On the other hand, some metal-organic frameworks with mixed-connected topologies have been reported, for example, Pt3O4, boracite, twisted boracite, PtS, rutile, pyrite, and anatase. However, there is an unfavorable lack of investigation on binodal high-connected structures, such as (3,8)-, (4,8)-, (3,9)-, and (3,10)-connected frameworks. Recently, our group has reported the first (6,8)-connected self-penetrating network using an asymmetric neutral ligand based on dinuclear zinc clusters, as six-connected nodes, and trinuclear zinc clusters, as eight-connected nodes. It is a great challenge to achieve MOFs based on binodal high-connected nets in coordination chemistry. Among the reported binodal high-connected structures, connected nodes are always various metal clusters and/or organic ligand. The metal organic complex as a node is scarce.

elements.content: Tetrapodands have long been used in both coordination chemistry, typically, N,N,N′,N′-tetrakis(2′-benzimidazolyl methyl)-1,2-ethanediamine (EDTB) and their derivatives with different substituent groups in benzimidazole ring (methyl, ethyl, n-butyl, and benzyl). However, use of these ligands in MOFs for the construction of high dimensional structures has not been fully realized because the cagelike, boxlike, or capsulelike coordination modes prevent the expansion of the structures. On the other hand, the results of our previous studies show that, in the construction of new MOFs, multicarboxylate ligands act as multifunctional organic ligands which play important roles. They can show various coordination modes to metal ions resulting from completely or partially deprotonated sites to allow for the large diversity in the topologies. And they also have the ability to act as hydrogen bonds acceptors and donors to assemble supramolecular structures. An interesting question that arises from this is whether EDTB can be modified to construct the novel multifunctional ligand which combines the characters of EDTB and carboxylate group. On the basis of aforementioned considerations, we designed and synthesized the ligand 4,4′,4′′,4′′′-(2,2′,2′′,2′′′-(ethane-1,2-diylbis(azanetriyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrakis(1H-benzo[d]imidazole-2,1-diyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrabenzoic acid (H4L) showing both capsulelike and arm characters. Here, we investigated the reaction of H4L with Ni(NO3)2·6H2O in ionothermal and hydrohermal conditions. Compound 1 represents the new type metal−organic replicate of PoCl2 with the scu net (square planar and cubical vertices, sometimes called the PoCl2 net) containing an eight-connecting polynuclear cluster and a large four-connecting complex to date, based on use of ionic liquids (1-ethyl-3-methylimidazolium chloride [Emim]Cl) as both the solvent and the structure-directing agent (or template). And different compounds [Ni2(H2O)2L]·7(H2O) (2) have been obtained by the hydrothermal method. By inspection of the structures of 1 and 2, it is believed that the different reaction conditions play important roles in forming the final structures.
elements.clean_text: Tetrapodands have long been used in both coordination chemistry, typically, N,N,N',N'-tetrakis(2'-benzimidazolyl methyl)-1,2-ethanediamine (EDTB) and their derivatives with different substituent groups in benzimidazole ring (methyl, ethyl, n-butyl, and benzyl). However, use of these ligands in MOFs for the construction of high dimensional structures has not been fully realized because the cagelike, boxlike, or capsulelike coordination modes prevent the expansion of the structures. On the other hand, the results of our previous studies show that, in the construction of new MOFs, multicarboxylate ligands act as multifunctional organic ligands which play important roles. They can show various coordination modes to metal ions resulting from completely or partially deprotonated sites to allow for the large diversity in the topologies. And they also have the ability to act as hydrogen bonds acceptors and donors to assemble supramolecular structures. An interesting question that arises from this is whether EDTB can be modified to construct the novel multifunctional ligand which combines the characters of EDTB and carboxylate group. On the basis of aforementioned considerations, we designed and synthesized the ligand 4,4',4'',4'''-(2,2',2'',2'''-(ethane-1,2-diylbis(azanetriyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrakis(1H-benzo[d]imidazole-2,1-diyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrabenzoic acid (H4L) showing both capsulelike and arm characters. Here, we investigated the reaction of H4L with Ni(NO3)2⋅6H2O in ionothermal and hydrohermal conditions. Compound 1 represents the new type metal-organic replicate of PoCl2 with the scu net (square planar and cubical vertices, sometimes called the PoCl2 net) containing an eight-connecting polynuclear cluster and a large four-connecting complex to date, based on use of ionic liquids (1-ethyl-3-methylimidazolium chloride [Emim]Cl) as both the solvent and the structure-directing agent (or template). And different compounds [Ni2(H2O)2L]⋅7(H2O) (2) have been obtained by the hydrothermal method. By inspection of the structures of 1 and 2, it is believed that the different reaction conditions play important roles in forming the final structures.

elements.clean_text: 1  Synthesis of H4L Ligand

elements.content:
Chemicals were purchased from commercial sources and used without further purification. The ligand EDTB was prepared according to the literature procedure.

Synthesis of H<sub>4</sub>L

A mixture of EDTB (100 mmol) and NaOH (400 mmol) in DMSO (100 mL) was stirred at 5 °C for 2 h, and then 4-(chloromethyl)benzonitrile (400 mmol) was added. The mixture was cooled to room temperature after stirring at 70 °C for 24 h and then poured into 500 mL of water. A yellow solid of 4,4′,4′′,4′′′-(2,2′,2′′,2′′′-(ethane-1,2-diylbis(azanetriyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrakis(1H-benzo[d]imidazole-2,1-diyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrabenzonitrile (L′) (Scheme ) formed immediately, which was isolated by filtration in 84% yield after drying in air.
elements.clean_text:
Experimental Section

General Procedures

Chemicals were purchased from commercial sources and used without further purification. The ligand EDTB was prepared according to the literature procedure. 

Synthesis of H4L

A mixture of EDTB (100 mmol) and NaOH (400 mmol) in DMSO (100 mL) was stirred at 5 °C for 2 h, and then 4-(chloromethyl)benzonitrile (400 mmol) was added. The mixture was cooled to room temperature after stirring at 70 °C for 24 h and then poured into 500 mL of water. A yellow solid of 4,4',4'',4'''-(2,2',2'',2'''-(ethane-1,2-diylbis(azanetriyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrakis(1H-benzo[d]imidazole-2,1-diyl))tetrakis(methylene)tetrabenzonitrile (L') (Scheme ) formed immediately, which was isolated by filtration in 84% yield after drying in air.

elements.content: A mixture of L′ (100 mmol) and KOH (2.00 mol) in H2O (400 mL) was stirred at 100 °C for 48 h and was cooled to room temperature. Then the mixture was adjusted to pH ≈ 5 with HCl (1.0 mol·L−1), and a white solid of H4L formed immediately, which was isolated by filtration in 52% yield after drying in air. IR (cm−1): 3425 (s) 2946 (s) 1704 (s) 1614 (s) 1517 (w) 1461 (m) 1418 (m) 1373 (w) 1317 (w) 1259 (m) 1178 (w) 1112 (m) 1016 (w) 953 (w) 860 (w) 747 (s). 1H and 13C NMR spectra in the (Figure S1).
elements.clean_text: A mixture of L' (100 mmol) and KOH (2.00 mol) in H2O (400 mL) was stirred at 100 °C for 48 h and was cooled to room temperature. Then the mixture was adjusted to pH ~ 5 with HCl (1.0 mol⋅L-1), and a white solid of H4L formed immediately, which was isolated by filtration in 52% yield after drying in air. IR (cm-1): 3425 (s) 2946 (s) 1704 (s) 1614 (s) 1517 (w) 1461 (m) 1418 (m) 1373 (w) 1317 (w) 1259 (m) 1178 (w) 1112 (m) 1016 (w) 953 (w) 860 (w) 747 (s). 1H and 13C NMR spectra in the  (Figure S1).

elements.content: A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2·6H2O (3.00 mmol), and [Emim]Cl (8 g) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, and then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C·h−1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C·h−1. Green crystals of 1 were collected in 56% yield. Anal. Calcd for C144H150N26O36Cl2Ni7 (3302.77): C, 52.37; H, 4.58; N, 11.03; Ni, 12.44. Found: C, 52.99; H, 4.38; N, 10.93; Ni, 12.74%.
elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of [Ni7(H2O)6L2(O)2](Cl)2(NO3)2⋅6(H2O)⋅(Emim)2 (1)

A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2⋅6H2O (3.00 mmol), and [Emim]Cl (8 g) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, and then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C⋅h-1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C⋅h-1. Green crystals of 1 were collected in 56% yield. Anal. Calcd for C144H150N26O36Cl2Ni7 (3302.77): C, 52.37; H, 4.58; N, 11.03; Ni, 12.44. Found: C, 52.99; H, 4.38; N, 10.93; Ni, 12.74%.

elements.content: A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2·6H2O (3.00 mmol), and H2O (10 mL) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C·h−1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C·h−1. Green crystals of 2 were collected in 64% yield. Anal. Calcd for C66H70N10Ni2O17 (1392.74): C, 56.95; H, 5.07; N, 10.06, Ni, 8.43. Found: C, 57.05; H, 4.99; N, 9.98, Ni, 8.49%.
elements.clean_text:
Synthesis of [Ni2(H2O)2L]⋅7(H2O) (2)

A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2⋅6H2O (3.00 mmol), and H2O (10 mL) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C⋅h-1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C⋅h-1. Green crystals of 2 were collected in 64% yield. Anal. Calcd for C66H70N10Ni2O17 (1392.74): C, 56.95; H, 5.07; N, 10.06, Ni, 8.43. Found: C, 57.05; H, 4.99; N, 9.98, Ni, 8.49%.

elements.content: The C, H, and N elemental analysis was conducted on a Perkin−Elmer 240C elemental analyzer. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was performed on a Perkin−Elmer TG-7 analyzer heated from 35 to 600 °C under nitrogen. Diffuse reflectivity spectra were collected on a finely ground sample with a Cary 500 spectrophotometer equipped with a 110 mm diameter integrating sphere. Diffuse reflectivity was measured from 200 to 1500 nm using barium sulfate (BaSO4) as a standard with 100% reflectance.
elements.clean_text:
Physical Measurements

The C, H, and N elemental analysis was conducted on a Perkin-Elmer 240C elemental analyzer. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was performed on a Perkin-Elmer TG-7 analyzer heated from 35 to 600 °C under nitrogen. Diffuse reflectivity spectra were collected on a finely ground sample with a Cary 500 spectrophotometer equipped with a 110 mm diameter integrating sphere. Diffuse reflectivity was measured from 200 to 1500 nm using barium sulfate (BaSO4) as a standard with 100% reflectance.

elements.content: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data for compounds 1 and 2 were recorded on a Bruker Apex CCD diffractometer with graphite-monochromated MoKα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at 293 K. Absorption corrections were applied using multiscan technique. All the structures were solved by Direct Method of SHELXS-97 and refined by full-matrix least-squares techniques using the SHELXL-97 program within WINGX. The hydrogen atoms of the organic ligands were refined as rigid groups. Non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic temperature parameters. The water H atoms in compounds 1 and 2 could not be positioned reliably. The ionic liquids were disordered and could not be located. The diffuse electron densities in the structure were therefore treated using the SQUEEZE routine in the program PLATON in 1. The disordered ionic liquids were confirmed together with elemental analysis and TG analysis.
elements.clean_text:
X-ray Crystallography

Single-crystal X-ray diffraction data for compounds 1 and 2 were recorded on a Bruker Apex CCD diffractometer with graphite-monochromated MoKα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at 293 K. Absorption corrections were applied using multiscan technique. All the structures were solved by Direct Method of SHELXS-97 and refined by full-matrix least-squares techniques using the SHELXL-97 program within WINGX. The hydrogen atoms of the organic ligands were refined as rigid groups. Non-hydrogen atoms were refined with anisotropic temperature parameters. The water H atoms in compounds 1 and 2 could not be positioned reliably. The ionic liquids were disordered and could not be located. The diffuse electron densities in the structure were therefore treated using the SQUEEZE routine in the program PLATON in 1. The disordered ionic liquids were confirmed together with elemental analysis and TG analysis.

elements.content: (a) Coordination environment of NiII atoms in 1 with the ellipsoids drawn at the 30% probability level; hydrogen atoms were omitted for clarity. (b) Ball-and-stick and polyhedral representations of a pentanuclear nickel cluster [Ni5(CO2)8O2]. (c) Schematic view of four-connecting metal organic complex of 1. (d) Schematic description of the three-dimensional (3D) net of 1. (e) The scu topology (left) and the flu net topology (right). (Pink represent 4-connected nodes and yellow represents an 8-connected node.)
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) Coordination environment of NiII atoms in 1 with the ellipsoids drawn at the 30% probability level; hydrogen atoms were omitted for clarity. (b) Ball-and-stick and polyhedral representations of a pentanuclear nickel cluster [Ni5(CO2)8O2]. (c) Schematic view of four-connecting metal organic complex of 1. (d) Schematic description of the three-dimensional (3D) net of 1. (e) The scu topology (left) and the flu net topology (right). (Pink represent 4-connected nodes and yellow represents an 8-connected node.)

elements.content: Single crystal X-ray analysis (Table ) revealed that compound 1 is constructed from four kinds of NiII cations and one kind of L4− anion (Figure a). Atom Ni1 is six-coordinated and exhibits a twisted octahedral geometry [NiN6], which is surrounded by six nitrogen atoms from the same L4− ligand. Meanwhile, Ni2, Ni3, and Ni4 show twisted octahedral geometries [NiO6], which are completed by four carboxylic oxygen atoms from different L4− ligands, one coordination water molecule and one μ3-O group for Ni2, four carboxylic oxygen atoms from different L4− ligands and two μ3-O groups for Ni3 lying at an inversion center, and three carboxylic oxygen atoms from different L4− ligands, two coordination water molecules and one μ3-O group for Ni4. All the bond distances and angles are within normal range (). The deprotonated L ligand exhibits a special coordination mode which wraps a NiII ion in the center and links eight NiII ions with four carboxylic groups displaying monodentate, monodentate, tridentate, and tridentate coordination modes (), respectively. The structure of 1 contains a pentanuclear nickel cluster [Ni5(CO2)8O2] (Figure b), in which each μ3-O interlinks three crystallographically unique Ni atoms, with nonbonding Ni···Ni distances of 3.073 and 3.038 Ǻ. To date, only a few compounds based on pentanuclear nickel clusters have been observed in MOFs. The pentanuclear nickel cluster of [Ni5(L)2(OAc)6(OH)2] ([HL = 2-{[(2-dimethylaminoethyl)ethylamino]methyl}-6-ethyliminomethyl-4-methylphenol]) is similar to [Ni5(CO2)8O2] in compound 1. In [Ni5(L)2(OAc)6(OH)2], every pentanuclear nickel cluster is constructed from three kinds of NiII cations. All Ni cations are six-coordinated and exhibit a twisted octahedral geometry. One is surrounded by one nitrogen atoms and five oxygen atoms. The second is surrounded by two nitrogen atoms and four oxygen atoms. The last is surrounded by six oxygen atoms. It is different from the pentanuclear nickel cluster of 1, in which every Ni cation is six-coordinated by six O atoms. In a further study into the structure of compound 1, each pentanuclear metal cluster is surrounded by eight carboxylate groups from different L4− ligands. This, therefore, defines an eight-connected node. Each L4− ligand, packaging a Ni ion in the center [NiL]2− (Figure c), is further linked to four nearest-pentanickel clusters and acts as a four-connected node. The framework of 1 results in a rare (4,8)-connected net with the Schläfli symbol of {(44.62)2(416.612)} and has the topology of a scu net (Figure d).
elements.clean_text:
Structure Description of 1 

Single crystal X-ray analysis (Table ) revealed that compound 1 is constructed from four kinds of NiII cations and one kind of L4- anion (Figure a). Atom Ni1 is six-coordinated and exhibits a twisted octahedral geometry [NiN6], which is surrounded by six nitrogen atoms from the same L4- ligand. Meanwhile, Ni2, Ni3, and Ni4 show twisted octahedral geometries [NiO6], which are completed by four carboxylic oxygen atoms from different L4- ligands, one coordination water molecule and one μ3-O group for Ni2, four carboxylic oxygen atoms from different L4- ligands and two μ3-O groups for Ni3 lying at an inversion center, and three carboxylic oxygen atoms from different L4- ligands, two coordination water molecules and one μ3-O group for Ni4. All the bond distances and angles are within normal range (). The deprotonated L ligand exhibits a special coordination mode which wraps a NiII ion in the center and links eight NiII ions with four carboxylic groups displaying monodentate, monodentate, tridentate, and tridentate coordination modes (), respectively. The structure of 1 contains a pentanuclear nickel cluster [Ni5(CO2)8O2] (Figure b), in which each μ3-O interlinks three crystallographically unique Ni atoms, with nonbonding Ni⋅⋅⋅Ni distances of 3.073 and 3.038 Ǻ. To date, only a few compounds based on pentanuclear nickel clusters have been observed in MOFs. The pentanuclear nickel cluster of [Ni5(L)2(OAc)6(OH)2] ([HL = 2-{[(2-dimethylaminoethyl)ethylamino]methyl}-6-ethyliminomethyl-4-methylphenol]) is similar to [Ni5(CO2)8O2] in compound 1. In [Ni5(L)2(OAc)6(OH)2], every pentanuclear nickel cluster is constructed from three kinds of NiII cations. All Ni cations are six-coordinated and exhibit a twisted octahedral geometry. One is surrounded by one nitrogen atoms and five oxygen atoms. The second is surrounded by two nitrogen atoms and four oxygen atoms. The last is surrounded by six oxygen atoms. It is different from the pentanuclear nickel cluster of 1, in which every Ni cation is six-coordinated by six O atoms. In a further study into the structure of compound 1, each pentanuclear metal cluster is surrounded by eight carboxylate groups from different L4- ligands. This, therefore, defines an eight-connected node. Each L4- ligand, packaging a Ni ion in the center [NiL]2- (Figure c), is further linked to four nearest-pentanickel clusters and acts as a four-connected node. The framework of 1 results in a rare (4,8)-connected net with the Schläfli symbol of {(44.62)2(416.612)} and has the topology of a scu net (Figure d).

R 1 = Σ∣∣F o∣ − ∣F c∣∣/Σ∣F o∣.

wR 2 = ∣Σw(∣F o∣2 − ∣F c ∣2)∣/Σ∣w(F o 2)2∣1/2.

Notably, previous examples of (4,8)-connected frameworks are very rare, and they are reminiscent of the binary inorganic compounds fluorite CaF2 (flu, the Schläfli symbol is (46)2(412.612.84), Figure e). Fluorite is one of the most important and frequently encountered structure types in minerals, and it is built from tetrahedral and cubical nodes. The scu network is built from square-planar and cubical nodes, and each four-connected node connects four eight-connected nodes. The structure of 1 is completely different from that of the reported PoCl2 net. Previous examples of this net are very rare indeed. Among them, a couple of inorganic salts such as PoCl2 are known to have this topology. The molecule-based compound so far assigned with this topology is [Fe2(H2O)4][MoIV(CN)8]·4H2O. Another scu net is [Ca[Co(ethylenediamine)(oxalato)2]2] n which is based on N−H···O hydrogen bonds. To date, compound K2[Co3(btec)2(H2O)4]·6H2O} n represents the first extended metal−organic replicate of scu net containing an eight-connecting tricobalt cluster and a large four-connecting organic ligand. Different from them, compound 1 contains a pentanickel cluster as an eight-connecting node and a sandwich metal organic complex [NiL]2− as a four-connecting node, which are distinct from the traditional organic ligand as a node or linker.
elements.clean_text: Notably, previous examples of (4,8)-connected frameworks are very rare, and they are reminiscent of the binary inorganic compounds fluorite CaF2 (flu, the Schläfli symbol is (46)2(412.612.84), Figure e). Fluorite is one of the most important and frequently encountered structure types in minerals, and it is built from tetrahedral and cubical nodes. The scu network is built from square-planar and cubical nodes, and each four-connected node connects four eight-connected nodes. The structure of 1 is completely different from that of the reported PoCl2 net. Previous examples of this net are very rare indeed. Among them, a couple of inorganic salts such as PoCl2 are known to have this topology. The molecule-based compound so far assigned with this topology is [Fe2(H2O)4][MoIV(CN)8]⋅4H2O. Another scu net is [Ca[Co(ethylenediamine)(oxalato)2]2] n  which is based on N-H⋅⋅⋅O hydrogen bonds. To date, compound K2[Co3(btec)2(H2O)4]⋅6H2O} n  represents the first extended metal-organic replicate of scu net containing an eight-connecting tricobalt cluster and a large four-connecting organic ligand. Different from them, compound 1 contains a pentanickel cluster as an eight-connecting node and a sandwich metal organic complex [NiL]2- as a four-connecting node, which are distinct from the traditional organic ligand as a node or linker.

elements.content: (a) Coordination environment of NiII atoms in 2 with the ellipsoids drawn at the 30% probability level; hydrogen atoms were omitted for clarity. (b, c) Ball-and-stick and polyhedral, and schematic representations of the one-dimensional (1D) structure of 2.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) Coordination environment of NiII atoms in 2 with the ellipsoids drawn at the 30% probability level; hydrogen atoms were omitted for clarity. (b, c) Ball-and-stick and polyhedral, and schematic representations of the one-dimensional (1D) structure of 2.

elements.content: When the traditional hydrothermal method was selected instead of ionothermal synthesis to react with similar starting materials, the result is largely unanticipated. Compound 2 was obtained, showing a 1D structure. In 2, there are two kinds of Ni atoms and one L4− ligand. Atom Ni1 is six-coordinated and exhibits a twisted octahedral geometry [NiN6], which is surrounded by six nitrogen atoms from the same L4− ligand. Meanwhile, Ni2 shows twisted octahedral geometries [NiO6], which are completed by four carboxylic oxygen atoms from three L4− ligands and two coordination water molecules (Figure a). Each L4− ligand coordinates a Ni1 ion in the center to form a [NiL]2− unit which links three Ni2 ions through three carboxylic groups based on monodentate, monodentate, and bidentate coordinate modes. One carboxylic group is deprotonated and does not coordinate to the metal center (). So [NiL]2− units are linked by Ni2 to give a 1D chainlike structure (Figure b,c).
elements.clean_text:
Structure Description of 2 

When the traditional hydrothermal method was selected instead of ionothermal synthesis to react with similar starting materials, the result is largely unanticipated. Compound 2 was obtained, showing a 1D structure. In 2, there are two kinds of Ni atoms and one L4- ligand. Atom Ni1 is six-coordinated and exhibits a twisted octahedral geometry [NiN6], which is surrounded by six nitrogen atoms from the same L4- ligand. Meanwhile, Ni2 shows twisted octahedral geometries [NiO6], which are completed by four carboxylic oxygen atoms from three L4- ligands and two coordination water molecules (Figure a). Each L4- ligand coordinates a Ni1 ion in the center to form a [NiL]2- unit which links three Ni2 ions through three carboxylic groups based on monodentate, monodentate, and bidentate coordinate modes. One carboxylic group is deprotonated and does not coordinate to the metal center (). So [NiL]2- units are linked by Ni2 to give a 1D chainlike structure (Figure b,c).

elements.clean_text: 2  Comparing Compounds 1 and 2

elements.content: When the same raw starting materials are selected, different compounds 1 and 2 are isolated with different synthesis methods at the same reaction temperature. The completed deprotonated L4− ions in 1 and 2 show different coordination modes, and it links eight metal centers with four carboxylate groups in 1 and coordinates three metal ions with three carboxylate groups in 2. In a comparison of compounds 1 and 2 (Scheme ), the pentanuclear nickel cluster in 1 is beneficial to connect multiligands and tends to give a higher dimensional structure. In different reaction conditions, ligands adopt various coordination modes and metal ions assemble to distinct formations, which result in the final 3D and 1D structures.
elements.clean_text: When the same raw starting materials are selected, different compounds 1 and 2 are isolated with different synthesis methods at the same reaction temperature. The completed deprotonated L4- ions in 1 and 2 show different coordination modes, and it links eight metal centers with four carboxylate groups in 1 and coordinates three metal ions with three carboxylate groups in 2. In a comparison of compounds 1 and 2 (Scheme ), the pentanuclear nickel cluster in 1 is beneficial to connect multiligands and tends to give a higher dimensional structure. In different reaction conditions, ligands adopt various coordination modes and metal ions assemble to distinct formations, which result in the final 3D and 1D structures.

elements.content: It is reported that inorganic metal oxides and polyoxometalate (POM)-based hybrid compounds show semiconducting properties, such as Zn3V2TeO10 (E g = 2.96 eV), Cd4V2Te3O15(E g = 2.66 eV), (Se2O5)Cl2 (E g = 4.4 eV), Sr4(Te3O8)Cl4 (E g = 4.0 eV), (n-Bu4N)2[Mo6O19] (E g = 2.68 eV), and (Bu4N)2-[Mo6O18-(≡NR)] (R = p-ClC6H4, m-ClC6H4, and R = o-ClC6H4) (E g = 2.15 eV, 2.26 eV, and 2.14 eV). And this pentanuclear nickel cluster may also exhibit this similar property. In order to explore the semiconductivity of compound 1, the measurement of diffuse reflectivity for the powder sample was used to achieve its band gap (E g). As shown in , for this compound, the corresponding well-defined optical absorption associated with band gap (E g) can be assessed at 4.10 eV. The reflectance spectrum measurements reveal the presence of an optical band gap and the nature of semiconductivity with a wide band gap for compound 1. The result is similar to inorganic metal oxides and it is rare in MOFs. The extended [Ni5(CO2)8O2] clusters in the hybrid structure appear to be mainly responsible for its wide optical band gap.
elements.clean_text:
Optical Band Gap

It is reported that inorganic metal oxides and polyoxometalate (POM)-based hybrid compounds show semiconducting properties, such as Zn3V2TeO10 (E g = 2.96 eV), Cd4V2Te3O15(E g = 2.66 eV), (Se2O5)Cl2 (E g = 4.4 eV), Sr4(Te3O8)Cl4 (E g = 4.0 eV), (n-Bu4N)2[Mo6O19] (E g = 2.68 eV), and (Bu4N)2-[Mo6O18-(≡NR)] (R = p-ClC6H4, m-ClC6H4, and R = o-ClC6H4) (E g = 2.15 eV, 2.26 eV, and 2.14 eV). And this pentanuclear nickel cluster may also exhibit this similar property. In order to explore the semiconductivity of compound 1, the measurement of diffuse reflectivity for the powder sample was used to achieve its band gap (E g). As shown in , for this compound, the corresponding well-defined optical absorption associated with band gap (E g) can be assessed at 4.10 eV. The reflectance spectrum measurements reveal the presence of an optical band gap and the nature of semiconductivity with a wide band gap for compound 1. The result is similar to inorganic metal oxides and it is rare in MOFs. The extended [Ni5(CO2)8O2] clusters in the hybrid structure appear to be mainly responsible for its wide optical band gap.

elements.content: In order to characterize the compounds more fully in terms of thermal stability, their thermal behaviors were studied by TGA. The experiments were performed on samples consisting of numerous single crystals of 1 and 2 under air atmosphere with a heating rate of 10 °C/min (.
elements.clean_text:
Thermal Analysis

In order to characterize the compounds more fully in terms of thermal stability, their thermal behaviors were studied by TGA. The experiments were performed on samples consisting of numerous single crystals of 1 and 2 under air atmosphere with a heating rate of 10 °C/min (.

elements.content: For compound 1, the weight loss in the range of 28−93 °C corresponds to the departure of lattice water molecules (observed, 3.1%; calculated, 3.3%), the weight losses in the range of 214−466 °C correspond to the removal of the corresponding organic components, coordination water molecules, and dissociative cations and ions, and the remaining weight corresponds to the formation of NiO (observed, 15.9%; calculated, 15.8%). The TGA curve of 2 shows that it loses the dissociative water molecules in the range of room temperature to 122 °C (obsd 9.4%, calcd 9.1%). The decomposition of the [Ni2(H2O)2L] composition occurs at 249 °C and is finished at 465 °C. The weight loss corresponds to the loss of organic components and coordination water molecules. The remaining weight of 11.0% corresponds to the percentage (calculated, 10.7%) of NiO.
elements.clean_text: For compound 1, the weight loss in the range of 28-93 °C corresponds to the departure of lattice water molecules (observed, 3.1%; calculated, 3.3%), the weight losses in the range of 214-466 °C correspond to the removal of the corresponding organic components, coordination water molecules, and dissociative cations and ions, and the remaining weight corresponds to the formation of NiO (observed, 15.9%; calculated, 15.8%). The TGA curve of 2 shows that it loses the dissociative water molecules in the range of room temperature to 122 °C (obsd 9.4%, calcd 9.1%). The decomposition of the [Ni2(H2O)2L] composition occurs at 249 °C and is finished at 465 °C. The weight loss corresponds to the loss of organic components and coordination water molecules. The remaining weight of 11.0% corresponds to the percentage (calculated, 10.7%) of NiO.

elements.content: In summary, two new coordination polymers have been successfully synthesized under the ionothermal and hydrothermal condition, by using NiII and H4L ligands. Compound 1 represents a special PoCl2 with the scu net in which a pentanickel cluster as an eight-connecting node and a sandwich metal organic complex [NiL]2− as a four-connecting node. Compound 2 is an infinite chainlike structure. The difference of two structures may be due to the different reaction conditions. The diffuse reflectivity spectrum measurements reveal that compound 1 with E g 4.10 eV are potential wide gap semiconductor materials. Altering the solvent from H2O to an ionic liquid can change the chemistry of the system. This work shows that ionothermal synthesis is a new route for preparing new MOFs. The ionothermal method presents a useful approach that can be further expanded to create a variety of functional materials.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusion

In summary, two new coordination polymers have been successfully synthesized under the ionothermal and hydrothermal condition, by using NiII and H4L ligands. Compound 1 represents a special PoCl2 with the scu net in which a pentanickel cluster as an eight-connecting node and a sandwich metal organic complex [NiL]2- as a four-connecting node. Compound 2 is an infinite chainlike structure. The difference of two structures may be due to the different reaction conditions. The diffuse reflectivity spectrum measurements reveal that compound 1 with E g 4.10 eV are potential wide gap semiconductor materials. Altering the solvent from H2O to an ionic liquid can change the chemistry of the system. This work shows that ionothermal synthesis is a new route for preparing new MOFs. The ionothermal method presents a useful approach that can be further expanded to create a variety of functional materials.

elements.content: X-ray crystallographic files (CIF), diagrams of the structure, selected bond distances and angles, 1H, 13C spectra and TGA curves of compounds 1 and 2. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.
elements.clean_text: X-ray crystallographic files (CIF), diagrams of the structure, selected bond distances and angles, 1H, 13C spectra and TGA curves of compounds 1 and 2. This material is available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

cln_elements.content:
A mixture of L′ (100 mmol) and KOH (2.00 mol) in H2O (400 mL) was stirred at 100 °C for 48 h and was cooled to room temperature. Then the mixture was adjusted to pH ≈ 5 with HCl (1.0 mol·L−1), and a white solid of H4L formed immediately, which was isolated by filtration in 52% yield after drying in air. IR (cm−1): 3425 (s) 2946 (s) 1704 (s) 1614 (s) 1517 (w) 1461 (m) 1418 (m) 1373 (w) 1317 (w) 1259 (m) 1178 (w) 1112 (m) 1016 (w) 953 (w) 860 (w) 747 (s). 1H and 13C NMR spectra in the (Figure S1).

Synthesis of [Ni<sub>7</sub>(H<sub>2</sub>O)<sub>6</sub>L<sub>2</sub>(O)<sub>2</sub>](Cl)<sub>2</sub>(NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>·6(H<sub>2</sub>O)·(Emim)<sub>2</sub> (<bold>1</bold>)

A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2·6H2O (3.00 mmol), and [Emim]Cl (8 g) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, and then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C·h−1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C·h−1. Green crystals of 1 were collected in 56% yield. Anal. Calcd for C144H150N26O36Cl2Ni7 (3302.77): C, 52.37; H, 4.58; N, 11.03; Ni, 12.44. Found: C, 52.99; H, 4.38; N, 10.93; Ni, 12.74%.

Synthesis of [Ni<sub>2</sub>(H<sub>2</sub>O)<sub>2</sub>L]·7(H<sub>2</sub>O) (<bold>2</bold>)

A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2·6H2O (3.00 mmol), and H2O (10 mL) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C·h−1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C·h−1. Green crystals of 2 were collected in 64% yield. Anal. Calcd for C66H70N10Ni2O17 (1392.74): C, 56.95; H, 5.07; N, 10.06, Ni, 8.43. Found: C, 57.05; H, 4.99; N, 9.98, Ni, 8.49%.

A mixture of L' (100 mmol) and KOH (2.00 mol) in H2O (400 mL) was stirred at 100 °C for 48 h and was cooled to room temperature. Then the mixture was adjusted to pH ~ 5 with HCl (1.0 mol⋅L-1), and a white solid of H4L formed immediately, which was isolated by filtration in 52% yield after drying in air. IR (cm-1): 3425 (s) 2946 (s) 1704 (s) 1614 (s) 1517 (w) 1461 (m) 1418 (m) 1373 (w) 1317 (w) 1259 (m) 1178 (w) 1112 (m) 1016 (w) 953 (w) 860 (w) 747 (s). 1H and 13C NMR spectra in the  (Figure S1).

Synthesis of [Ni7(H2O)6L2(O)2](Cl)2(NO3)2⋅6(H2O)⋅(Emim)2 (1)

A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2⋅6H2O (3.00 mmol), and [Emim]Cl (8 g) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, and then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C⋅h-1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C⋅h-1. Green crystals of 1 were collected in 56% yield. Anal. Calcd for C144H150N26O36Cl2Ni7 (3302.77): C, 52.37; H, 4.58; N, 11.03; Ni, 12.44. Found: C, 52.99; H, 4.38; N, 10.93; Ni, 12.74%.

Synthesis of [Ni2(H2O)2L]⋅7(H2O) (2)

A mixture of H4L (1.00 mmol), Ni(NO3)2⋅6H2O (3.00 mmol), and H2O (10 mL) was sealed in a 25 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. The container was heated to 150 °C and held at that temperature for 72 h, then cooled to 100 °C at a rate of 10 °C⋅h-1, held for 8 h, and further cooled to 30 °C at a rate of 5 °C⋅h-1. Green crystals of 2 were collected in 64% yield. Anal. Calcd for C66H70N10Ni2O17 (1392.74): C, 56.95; H, 5.07; N, 10.06, Ni, 8.43. Found: C, 57.05; H, 4.99; N, 9.98, Ni, 8.49%.

metadata.title: Metal−Organic Frameworks with Diverse Structures Constructed by Using Capsule-like Ligand and NiII Based on Ionothermal and Hydrothermal Methods
